column4: Just installed Ubuntu server, changed to Static IP and now the server CAN'T resolve addresses, it can access everywhere with IPs but not with Names. Any clue?
see what servers are being queries, if any, use command: dig google.com
i once had to remove /etc/resolvconf ...  but thats just a brute way to fix it
did you try the dig command? you should before removing
still the same > ping: unknown host www.google.com
not ping, use this command: dig google.com; dig @8.8.8.8 google.com
then your DNS server is the problem
8.8.8.8 is a google public dns server and you say it worked fine
looking back at your /etc/resolv.conf... you used your machine address as the DNS server! it should be 192.168.1.1 not .3 in your /etc/resolv.conf
